Augmented strength, stamina, and reflexes |}} '''Bonebreaker''' is a fictional [[supervillain]] appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. ==Publication history== {{expand section|date=January 2016}} He first appeared in ''The [[Uncanny X-Men]]'' #229 (May 1988) and was created by [[Chris Claremont]] and [[Marc Silvestri]]. ==Fictional character biography== Bonebreaker was the leader of the original [[Reavers (comics)|Reavers]], a gang of cyborgs living in a ghost town in Australia, who perpetrated robberies across the globe. Bonebreaker, as well as Pretty Boy and Skullbuster, avoided being sent through the [[Siege Perilous (comics)|Siege Perilous]] along with the other Reavers after being defeated by the [[X-Men]].{{Comic book reference | Writer = [[Chris Claremont]] | Penciller = [[Marc Silvestri]] | Inker = [[Dan Green (artist)|Dan Green]] | Story = Down Under | Title =The Uncanny X-Men | Issue = #229 | Date = May 1988 | Publisher = [[Marvel Comics]] | }} Following their defeat, Bonebreaker sought out [[Donald Pierce]] and [[Lady Deathstrike]] to aid in rebuilding the Reavers and defeating the X-Men.{{Citation needed|date=June 2013}} At this point, Pierce took over Bonebreaker's role as the Reavers leader. The Reavers never ended up battling the X-Men but encountered Wolverine, beat him half to death, and crucified him.{{Comic book reference | Writer = [[Chris Claremont]] | Penciller = [[Marc Silvestri]] | Inker = [[Dan Green (artist)|Dan Green]] | Story = Fever Dream | Title =The Uncanny X-Men | Issue = #251 | Date = Nov. 1989| Publisher = [[Marvel Comics]] | }} After Wolverine escaped, the Reavers attacked [[Muir Island]] where they battled the Muir Island X-Men and [[Freedom Force (comics)|Freedom Force]], killing Sunder, Stonewall, and Destiny before being defeated.{{Comic book reference | Writer = [[Chris Claremont]] | Penciller = [[Marc Silvestri]] | Inker = [[Dan Green (artist)|Dan Green]] | Story = Crash and Burn | Title =The Uncanny X-Men | Issue = #255 | Date = Dec. 1989| Publisher = [[Marvel Comics]] | }} After the Muir island massacre, Bonebreaker and the other Reavers continued to attack various heroes and mutants such as Wolverine,{{issue|date=September 2021}} [[Emma Frost]]'s factories,{{issue|date=September 2021}} Rogue,{{issue|date=September 2021}} and the [[Punisher]].{{issue|date=September 2021}} When Pierce was creating [[Albert (comics)|Albert]] and [[Elsie-Dee]] as a trap for Wolverine, Bonebreaker accidentally gave Elsie-Dee the maximum artificial intelligence instead of that of a 5 year old.{{issue|date=September 2021}} As a result, Elsie-Dee and Albert decided that Wolverine was a noble person and foiled Pierce's plans.{{issue|date=September 2021}} As part of the Upstarts' competition, [[Trevor Fitzroy]] sent his Sentinel to attack Pierce and the Reavers. The Sentinels arrived in Australia and quickly dispatched the Reavers.{{Comic book reference | Writer = [[Jim Lee]], [[John Byrne (comics)|John Byrne]], and [[While Portacio]] | Penciller = [[While Portacio]] | Inker = [[Art Thibert]] | Story = Fresh Upstart| Title =The Uncanny X-Men | Issue = #281 | Date = Oct. 1991| Publisher = [[Marvel Comics]] | }} Bonebreaker was among the other Reavers reassembled by Pierce and the [[Shadow King]], who attacked the X-treme X-Men. After being defeated again, the Reavers were handed over to the police.{{Comic book reference | Writer = [[Chris Claremont]] | Penciller = [[Salvador Larroca]] | Inker = [[Sandu Horca]] | Story = Queen of Shadows | Title = X-Treme X-Men Annual 2001 | Issue = 1 | Date = Feb. 2002| Publisher = [[Marvel Comics]] | }} Bonebreaker leads an attack on what he thinks is Wolverine, but is in actuality [[Old Man Logan|an alternate universe aged version of Logan]]. This attack kills several new-found friends of Logan. In response, Logan tears apart Bonebreaker and stabs him through the neck.''Old Man Logan'' #6 (2012) ==Powers and abilities== Like the other members of the Reavers, Bonebreaker is a cyborg and has bionic implants that augment strength, stamina, and reflexes beyond the levels of a normal human. Bonebreaker's legs have been replaced with a motorized chassis that drives on tank treads. It is outfitted with anti-aircraft weapons, missile launchers, and machine guns. Bonebreaker's upper torso can be removed from the chassis. ==Other versions== ===Ultimate Marvel=== A version of Bonebreaker appeared in [[Ultimate Marvel]] as one of the cyborg-hunting mutants on [[Krakoa]]. He has a cybernetic snake-like body. He is one of the only Reavers to actually be named after his 616-counterpart.''Ultimate Spider-Man'' #91 ==In other media== ===Television=== Bonebreaker and several other Reavers make an appearance in the 27th episode of the 1990s ''[[X-Men: The Animated Series|X-Men]]'' TV series.{{cn|date=January 2018}} ===Video games=== * Bonebreaker appears as an enemy character in the 1992 ''[[X-Men (1992 video game)|X-Men]]'' arcade game by Konami.{{cn|date=November 2017}} * Bonebreaker appears as a boss in ''[[The Punisher (arcade game)|The Punisher]]'' arcade game by Capcom.{{cn|date=November 2017}} * Bonebreaker appears in ''[[Marvel Heroes (video game)|Marvel Heroes]]''.{{cn|date=November 2017}} ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Bonebreaker}} [[Category:Characters created by Chris Claremont]] [[Category:Characters created by Marc Silvestri]] [[Category:Comics characters introduced in 1988]] [[Category:Fictional aviators]] [[Category:Marvel Comics characters with superhuman strength]] [[Category:Marvel Comics cyborgs]] [[Category:Marvel Comics supervillains]]
